page.title: 10SHEEP FARMING IN NAPTON
page.content: The farmer's wife came to school and told us about a lamb which was born in a puddle. She took the lamb indoors and gave it some gin and warm milk. She put a long tube down to its tummy so that it did not go into its lungs. When the lamb got better she let it loose in the field. Sheeps wool - before we washed the wool we took out the straw, bits of twigs, insects and maggots, then we washed it in soapy water and rinsed it in clean water and let it dry. When it was dry it felt softer than before. After we cleaned the wool we tried to dye it. First we got some berries, which we boiled with water in a saucepan for 8 minutes. We took the liquid off the cooker and added the wool which we left for 30 minutes. We pressed some wool on paper to see how much oil was in it.
